task: Two nearby lampposts are perpendicular to the ground, which is flat. One of the lampposts is 13 feet tall and has a shadow that is 4 feet long. At the same time, the shadow of the other lamppost is 1 feet long. How tall, in feet, is the other lamppost? (Assume that at a given point in time, the right triangles formed by the lampposts and their respective shadows are similar.)
explanation:
The correct answer is 3.25. Since the triangles are similar, the proportion is:
13/4 = x/1.
Solving for x gives: x = (13 × 1) / 4 = 3.25 feet.
